actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error, r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Fill missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id']).fillna(X_train.mean())

# Categorical columns handling
categorical_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numeric_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numeric_cols),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_cols)
    ])

# Define pipeline
pipeline = Pipeline(steps=[
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('classifier', LinearRegression())
])

# Split validation set
X_val, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Train model
pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_val = pipeline.predict(X_val)

# Calculate metrics
val_r2 = r2_score(y_val, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation R2 Score: {val_r2}')

# Predict on test set
submission_df = test_data[['Id']]
submission_df['SalePrice'] = pipeline.predict(test_data.drop(columns=['Id']))
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error, r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Fill missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id']).fillna(X_train.mean())

# Categorical columns handling
categorical_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numeric_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numeric_cols),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_cols)
    ])

# Define pipeline
pipeline = Pipeline(steps=[
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('classifier', LinearRegression())
])

# Split validation set
X_val, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Train model
pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_val = pipeline.predict(X_val)

# Calculate metrics
val_r2 = r2_score(y_val, y_pred_val)
print(f'Validation R2 Score: {val_r2}')

# Predict on test set
submission_df = test_data[['Id']]
submission_df['SalePrice'] = pipeline.predict(test_data.drop(columns=['Id']))
submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
